subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Quikscript extensions to Shavian (or separate script)
msgSnippet: ... I have some good passages in Shavian. I can convert one into QS but it will not have many ligatures. I m not a reader/writer of QS. Michael Everson *
messageBody:
On 20 Apr 2013, at 16:57, John Cowan <cowan@...> wrote:

> On the question of unification, it would be extremely useful if you could prepare a short document showing the same passage in both scripts, similar to your Coptic/Greek/Cyrillic document at <http://www.evertype.com/standards/cy/coptic.html>. My general feeling is that the structural correspondences are not enough and that legibility demands disunification, but seeing is believing.

I have some good passages in Shavian. I can convert one into QS but it will not have many ligatures. I'm not a reader/writer of QS.

Michael Everson * http://www.evertype.com/
